channel.title: Request Body :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: After the request headers and an extra CRLF (carriage return and line feed) is the request body. For GET and DELETE requests, there is no body. For POST, PUT, and PATCH, however, this section should contain the data being sent to the server. If there is a body, the headers should include Content-Type and Content-Length. The Content-Length is always provided as a count of octets (a set of eight bits). Thus, binary data is sent as an octet stream.
